scenario: Plug Power's stock price increased by over 10% in early trading, reaching $3 per share, before retreating to a 2% gain. The predicted approval of a $1.7 billion loan from the Department of Energy by the end of the week is attributed to the stock's initial surge. Morgan Stanley, however, reiterated its "underweight" rating on Plug Power stock, citing concerns that the loan will not be sufficient to save the company. The bank estimates that Plug Power will burn through $1.2 billion in cash in 2024, leaving it with less than $100 million in cash and over $900 million in debt. Morgan Stanley believes the company will need to raise at least $500 million more in cash this year, likely through the sale of new stock.
